query: ACES 1.3 RRT ODT Rec709 cube LUT
answer:
Do you want a ready-made .cube to download, or instructions to bake one yourself?

If you’re okay to bake it yourself (recommended for accuracy/traceability), here’s the quick way with OCIO v2 and the official ACES 1.3 OCIO config:

1) Get the ACES 1.3 OCIO config
- From the OpenColorIO-Config-ACES releases that target ACES 1.3 (e.g., “cg-config … aces-v1.3 …”). Set your OCIO env var to that .ocio. ([github.com](https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenColorIO-Config-ACES/releases))

2) Bake the ACES 1.3 RRT+ODT to Rec.709 as a .cube
- Using OCIO v2, bake the Display+View that corresponds to “RRT + Rec.709 ODT”:
  - Display: “Rec.1886 Rec.709 - Display”
  - View: “ACES 1.0 - SDR Video”
- Example (adjust paths/names as needed):
  - ociobakelut --display "Rec.1886 Rec.709 - Display" --view "ACES 1.0 - SDR Video" --shapersize 4096 --cubesize 33 --format iridas_cube ACES13_RRT_ODT_Rec709.cube
- Those Display/View names are the OCIO v2 components of the ACES RRT+Rec.709 ODT in the ACES 1.3 configs. ([community.acescentral.com](https://community.acescentral.com/t/ocio-2-1-aces-odts/5625?utm_source=openai))

Notes and validation
- In ACES 1.x, the Rec.709 SDR transform is ODT.Academy.Rec709_100nits_dim, applied after the RRT. The reference CTL transform IDs are RRT.a1.0.3 and ODT.Academy.Rec709_100nits_dim.a1.0.3. You can compare against the reference images in the aces-dev repo to sanity-check your baked LUT. ([community.acescentral.com](https://community.acescentral.com/t/how-to-define-precisely-what-happens-during-lmt-rrt-odt/3278?utm_source=openai))
- If you must bake from an older OCIO v1 ACES config, the single output colorspace “Output - Rec.709” already includes RRT+ODT. Example pattern: ociobakelut --inputspace ACEScct --outputspace "Output - Rec.709" --cubesize 33 --format iridas_cube out.cube. ([community.acescentral.com](https://community.acescentral.com/t/aces-feature-requests/979?utm_source=openai))
- A 3D .cube is an approximation of the ACES CTL RRT+ODT. It’s fine for preview or non-ACES environments, but finishing should use a proper ACES implementation (OCIO views or the CTL reference). ([community.acescentral.com](https://community.acescentral.com/t/example-test-for-preview-tier/3085?utm_source=openai))

If you tell me:
- your OCIO version (v1 or v2),
- which ACES 1.3 config you’re using (CG vs Studio),
- and your desired cube size (e.g., 33 or 65),

I can give you an exact, copy‑paste bake command (and shaper settings) for your setup. ([github.com](https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenColorIO-Config-ACES/releases))
